It displays the current time and updates in real-time, showcasing the use of React for managing state and rendering. The project also covers HTML, CSS, and JavaScript integration along with ReactJS concepts.

Players take turns selecting pieces and making moves, with the option to jump and eliminate opponent pieces. The game follows standard checkers rules, with victory conditions based on capturing all opponent pieces or rendering them immobile.

The system ensures secure and efficient management of student records, book availability, and transaction handling, including fines on overdue returns.

title: Chatting App
summary: This is a simple chat application built with Spring Boot that supports authentication, file uploads/downloads, and real-time messaging through WebSockets. It includes features like session management, HTTPS, and caching for better performance. Users can sign up, send text messages, upload files, and chat with others in a responsive and secure environment.

title: eWallet App
summary: The eWallet application is a full-stack project where users can sign up, log in, and manage their wallet by transferring money, adding funds, and checking balances. It provides a dashboard to view other users and transaction history. Built with Spring Boot for the backend and HTML/CSS with Thymeleaf for the frontend, the app offers a seamless payment experience.

title: Online Store App
summary: The Online Shopping App project is a backend application built with Java, Spring Boot, MySQL, and Hibernate. It provides various functionalities such as user registration, product management, customer profiles, order processing, and cart management through RESTful APIs. The project is designed to simulate a typical online shopping experience with endpoints for user and product actions.

title: Employee Manager App
summary: The Employee Management System is a full-stack application built with Spring Boot and MySQL for the backend and React for the frontend. It allows users to create, read, update, and delete employee records via a RESTful API. The application is tested with Postman and enables efficient management of employee data within a sports club community.

title: Payroll Management using Spring Boot
summary: The Employee Payroll Management System is a RESTful API built with Spring Boot, Java 17, and H2 Database, implementing CRUD operations for managing employee data. It leverages Spring HATEOAS for hypermedia-driven outputs and JPA for database interaction. The API can be tested using Postman to perform operations like creating, updating, retrieving, and deleting employee records.

title: Flight Management System
summary: The Flight Management System is a web application built with Angular for the frontend and Spring Boot for the backend, enabling users to manage flights, airlines, airports, and bookings. It includes features such as user authentication, role-based access control, and CRUD operations for flights, airlines, and airports. The system also provides a user-friendly interface and robust error handling for seamless interaction.

title: Determine If Your Food is Genetically Modified
summary: This project analyzes Scopus publication data from the petition "Scientists in Support of GMO Technology for Crop Improvement," focusing on academic signatories. The analysis includes data curation, publication processing, and the generation of a word cloud based on the titles of 17,662 unique publications. Python and R scripts were used to clean, process, and visualize the data, revealing key trends and terms in the field of GMO research.

title: Building Your Own Tool for Identifying DNA
summary: DNAnalyzer is a nonprofit platform offering on-device, machine learning-powered genomic insights. It enables free, private DNA analysis, reducing reliance on expensive, third-party services. With features like neural disorder analysis and FASTA file support, it aims to make genomic data accessible and secure for everyone.

title: Chatbot
summary: assistant-ui is an open-source TypeScript/React library for building AI chat interfaces with customizable UI components. It supports integration with various LLM providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Hugging Face, and includes features like auto-scrolling, file attachments, and markdown support. The library offers flexible backend integration options through AI SDK, LangGraph, or custom APIs.

title: Climate Change Impact Analyser (on Global Food Supply)
summary: This project visualizes the effects of climate change on global food production using data from the Socioeconomic Data And Applications Center (SEDAC). The goal is to assess the potential impacts of climate change on crop production through interactive web-based data visualizations. The data covers climate and socioeconomic scenarios from 1970 to 2080 and is used for research and decision-making.

title: Weather Prediction
summary: This project analyzes and visualizes global weather data, focusing on temperature, precipitation, pressure, and other meteorological factors. It uses SQL, Excel, Power BI/Tableau, and Python to process and present the data through interactive charts and dashboards. The project aims to help users understand weather trends and patterns in a visually appealing way.

title: Google Ads Keyword Generation
summary: This project automates the generation of keywords for Search Engine Marketing (SEM) campaigns using Python. Instead of manually generating keywords, the program quickly produces all relevant keywords for SEM, saving marketers significant time. It's a valuable tool for businesses looking to optimize their Google Ads campaigns efficiently.

title: Traffic Signs Recognition
summary: This project develops a Traffic Sign Recognition system using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) to classify traffic signs for advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and autonomous vehicles. It uses the German Traffic Sign Recognition Benchmark (GTSRB) dataset, which includes over 50,000 images of 43 traffic sign classes. The system can accurately recognize signs like "Stop," "Yield," and "Speed Limit," improving road safety and efficiency.

title: Wine Quality Analysis
summary: This project predicts the quality of wines based on physicochemical properties such as pH, alcohol content, and acidity using machine learning models. It utilizes a dataset of Vinho Verde wines with quality ratings ranging from 1 to 10. The model can assist wine producers in improving quality and help consumers predict wine quality.

title: Stock Market Prediction
summary: This project uses deep learning techniques, particularly LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory), to predict stock prices for Google based on historical data. It focuses on technical analysis, including data preprocessing, feature scaling, and model development using machine learning algorithms. The project aims to visualize stock trends and predict future price movements, helping investors make informed decisions.

title: Fake News Detection
summary: This project uses machine learning algorithms and natural language processing techniques to classify news articles as true or false, helping to detect fake news. It leverages the LIAR dataset and various classifiers like Logistic Regression, Naive Bayes, and Random Forest for fake news detection. The final model, Logistic Regression, is used to predict the truthfulness of news headlines with a probability score.

title: Video Classification
summary: This project focuses on video classification using the UCF101 dataset with two models: 3D CNN and CNN+RNN (CRNN), leveraging PyTorch for action recognition. It uses preprocessed video data and applies models like 3D CNN, ResNet-152-CNN+LSTM to classify videos into 101 action categories. The project provides training, testing, and evaluation scripts for action recognition, offering pretrained models for improved performance.

title: Human Action Recognition
summary: This project focuses on Human Action Recognition (HAR) using deep learning techniques, specifically leveraging VGG16 with transfer learning for video classification. The model identifies various human actions, such as walking, running, and talking, using preprocessed training data. Key techniques include categorical cross-entropy loss, Adam optimization, and model performance evaluation through accuracy and log loss, with recommendations for improving accuracy and preventing overfitting.

title: Medical Report Generation using CT Scans
summary: This project focuses on generating medical reports for chest X-rays using deep learning, specifically employing encoder-decoder architectures with attention mechanisms. The model processes X-ray images and generates descriptive medical reports that highlight key findings. It enhances the report generation process by improving accuracy and context understanding through the use of attention layers.

title: Email Classification
summary: This project focuses on email classification, categorizing emails into Normal, Spam, and Fraud using various machine learning classifiers like SVM, Nave Bayes, Decision Trees, and ensemble methods. It processes text data using TF-IDF and Count Vectorizers, evaluating model performance with metrics such as accuracy, precision, and recall. The best performing model was found to be an ensemble vote of SVM, Random Forest, and Bagging classifiers, trained on TF-IDF features without stemming.

title: Uber Data Analysis
summary: This project involves analyzing Uber pricing data using exploratory data analysis (EDA) and machine learning models to predict prices based on various features. After feature selection using recursive feature elimination, the models Decision Tree, Random Forest, and Gradient Boosting Regressor showed high accuracy, with Random Forest being chosen for its resistance to overfitting. The final model is used to predict Uber prices, aiding in better pricing analysis.

title: Sound Classification
summary: This project involves audio classification using deep learning models (ANN, CNN1D, CNN2D) to categorize urban sounds into ten categories. It utilizes feature extraction with Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCC) and compares model performance in terms of accuracy, training time, and prediction time. The models are deployed using Django, allowing users to record and classify real-time audio.

title: Credit Card Fraud Detection
summary: This project focuses on detecting fraudulent credit card transactions using machine learning techniques, including K-Nearest Neighbors, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machine, and Decision Tree. The dataset used consists of transaction data with features transformed using PCA, and the goal is to identify fraudulent transactions with high accuracy. The KNN and Decision Tree models performed best, achieving 100% accuracy, ensuring enhanced security and customer satisfaction.

title: Sign Language Recognition
summary: The Realtime Sign Language Detection Using LSTM Model is a deep learning-based project that recognizes and interprets sign language gestures in real time using an LSTM neural network. It provides a user-friendly interface and supports multiple gestures, offering high accuracy for effective communication, especially for the deaf and hard of hearing community. The system is built with Python, TensorFlow, OpenCV, and Numpy, and is open-source for easy customization and integration.

title: Flower Class Prediction
summary: The Iris Flower Classification project uses machine learning to classify iris flowers into three species: Setosa, Versicolor, and Virginica, based on their physical measurements. The project involves data exploration, preprocessing, and model training, with the tuned Random Forest model selected as the final classifier due to its high accuracy. The model can be applied in fields like botany and horticulture to automate species identification.

title: Color Detection
summary: The Color Detection project allows real-time identification of colors using a webcam or an image. It works by calculating the distance between the detected color and a predefined dataset of colors, finding the closest match. The system uses OpenCV and Python to detect and display the color names efficiently.

title: Loan Prediction
summary: The Loan Prediction project uses machine learning techniques to predict whether a loan applicant can repay their loan based on various attributes like income, education, and property area. The project involves data analysis with pandas and visualization with seaborn, followed by model training using XGBoost and scikit-learn. It also incorporates hyperparameter tuning and voting ensemble methods to improve prediction accuracy.

title: Road Traffic Prediction
summary: The Traffic Prediction project uses machine learning algorithms, specifically Random Forest and Support Vector Regression, to predict traffic congestion based on factors like day, temperature, and weather conditions. The dataset includes traffic levels coded on a five-level scale, with additional features like zone and temperature. The model achieved an accuracy of 86.58% with Random Forest and 87.84% with Support Vector Regression, showcasing effective traffic forecasting.

title: Income Classification
summary: The Income Classification project predicts whether an individual earns more or less than $50K per year based on various features such as education, relationship status, and capital gain. The final model used is a Random Forest classifier with a precision score of 87%. Deployed as a Streamlit app, it offers a tool for financial institutions to estimate income when applicant information is incomplete or confidential.

title: Speech Emotion Recognition
summary: The Speech Emotion Analyzer project uses machine learning to detect emotions from speech, leveraging datasets like RAVDESS and SAVEE. By extracting audio features with the LibROSA library, a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model was built to classify emotions with over 70% accuracy. The model was tested with live voice recordings, successfully predicting emotions like anger, happiness, and sadness.

title: Celebrity Voice Prediction
summary: The Speaker Recognition project identifies celebrities based on their voice using deep neural networks. By extracting audio features such as MFCC, Mel-spectrogram, and Tonnetz, a CNN model was trained, achieving a 0.73 F1-score. The model was tested on the VoxCeleb dataset, successfully recognizing celebrity voices and outperformed audience guesses in a live demo.

title: Store Sales Prediction
summary: The Retail Sales Prediction project focuses on forecasting daily sales for Rossmann's 1,115 stores across Germany, using machine learning techniques. By performing feature engineering, exploratory data analysis, and hyperparameter tuning, the model achieved a 5.65% MAPE with high accuracy. The insights generated help optimize budget and inventory planning for future sales.

title: Detecting Parkinson's Disease
summary: The Parkinson's Disease Detection project uses machine learning to identify instances of Parkinson's Disease. After training multiple models, the Random Forest Classifier emerged as the best performer, achieving an accuracy of 99.61% and an F1 score of 0.96. The project includes data preprocessing, exploratory analysis, and model evaluation to optimize detection accuracy.

title: Air Pollution Prediction
summary: The Air Pollution Prediction project uses a Random Forest algorithm to predict real-time air quality levels in urban cities, focusing on particulate matter and AQI. By analyzing historical data from Bangalore, India, the system aims to offer accurate and cost-effective predictions for pollution control. The goal is to provide valuable air quality information for public awareness and management.

title: Age & Gender Detection
summary: The Gender and Age Detection project uses deep learning techniques to predict a person's gender and age range from an image or webcam input. It leverages the Adience dataset for training and utilizes models for age and gender classification. The project supports real-time detection through images or webcam and provides accurate results in various conditions.

title: Optimizing Product Price
summary: The Retail Price Optimization project uses regression trees to develop a pricing algorithm aimed at optimizing retail prices. The model helps determine optimal prices based on various factors to maximize profits. This serves as a foundational step toward building a dynamic pricing system for retail businesses.

title: Breast Cancer Prediction
summary: The Breast Cancer Prediction project uses machine learning and deep learning algorithms to predict whether a breast cancer tumor is malignant or benign. It utilizes the Breast Cancer Wisconsin dataset for training and testing models, comparing performance based on accuracy, F1 score, recall, and precision. The goal is to aid early diagnosis and support medical decision-making through accurate predictions.

title: Analyze COVID Vaccination Progress Using Python
summary: This project explores COVID-19 vaccination progress worldwide from December 2020 to April 2021 using EDA techniques with Python libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib. It involved cleaning, wrangling, and visualizing data to answer key hypotheses regarding vaccination rates, country comparisons, and trends. The dataset includes information on total vaccinations, people vaccinated, daily vaccination rates, and vaccine distribution across various countries.

title: Financial Status Analysis For Credit Score Rating
summary: This project aims to predict individuals' credit scores using machine learning models, with a focus on financial history and personal information. It involves exploratory data analysis, preprocessing, and training various models like Random Forest, with performance evaluated using metrics like accuracy, precision, and recall. The best model is then used to make predictions on new data, demonstrating practical skills in data science and machine learning.

title: Movie Based Recommendation
summary: This project builds a basic movie recommendation system using Python and the Pandas library, utilizing a subset of the MovieLens dataset. It calculates correlations between movies to recommend similar ones based on user input. The system provides the top 4 recommended movies based on a text input query.

title: Real-time Traffic Prediction
summary: This project involves real-time traffic prediction using time series forecasting, where the model is trained on historical data and updated using a rolling window technique. It evaluates the model's performance using metrics like Mean Squared Error (MSE). The script uses Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and TensorFlow for training and forecasting.

title: Image Captioning
summary: This project focuses on image captioning using deep neural networks, incorporating Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), and the Attention Mechanism. It uses Inception V3 for feature extraction and a simplified Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) for sentence generation, achieving high BLEU scores. The model, trained on the Flickr8k dataset, demonstrates promising results in generating accurate and contextually relevant captions for images.

title: DSA Question Predicter
summary: The DSA Practice Tracker is a web-based platform designed to help individuals prepare for technical interviews by providing a curated set of Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) questions from platforms like Geeks for Geeks and LeetCode. It offers categorized questions by difficulty levels and tracks users' progress. The app features a user-friendly interface with search functionality and progress tracking.

title: IoT Social Distancing & Monitoring for Queue
summary: This project uses computer vision to track social distancing by detecting people in images and calculating real-world distances between them using a Tiny YOLO V2 model. It identifies crowds and visualizes the results while transforming image coordinates through homography matrices. The system integrates with SAS Event Stream Processing for real-time video analysis and crowd detection.

title: IoT Covid Patient Health Monitor in Quarantine
summary: This IoT-based patient health monitoring system uses an ESP32 board and sensors like MAX30100, DS18B20, and DHT11 to track vital health parameters such as heart rate, body temperature, and oxygen levels. Data is displayed in real-time via a web interface, allowing remote monitoring. The system aims to expand to medical institutions with advanced analytics, sensor integration, and enhanced security for holistic healthcare management.

title: IoT based Manhole Detection and Monitoring System
summary: The DSCWOW Manhole Monitoring System is an IoT-based solution designed to monitor the health of manholes in real-time. It tracks parameters such as structural integrity, temperature, and humidity to ensure safety and prevent potential hazards. The system provides live updates and alerts for efficient management and maintenance.

title: IoT based Smart Energy Meter Monitoring with Theft Detection
summary: The IoT-based Smart Energy Meter project uses an ESP32 board to monitor electricity consumption and prevent power theft. It collects real-time data from current and voltage sensors, which is then uploaded to the Blynk app for remote monitoring. The system enables efficient energy usage management and provides theft detection, making electricity consumption more controllable and secure.

title: IoT based Intelligent Gas Leakage Detector Using Arduino
summary: The Smart Gas Leakage Detector is an IoT-based system that detects LPG/CNG gas leaks and triggers an alarm. It sends an alert message to the owner and shows the location on Google Maps. The system uses an Arduino UNO, MQ6 gas sensor, and SIM900 GSM module for efficient detection and communication.

title: IoT based Smart Agriculture Monitoring System Project
summary: The IoT-based Smart Agriculture System monitors environmental factors like temperature, humidity, and soil moisture using sensors such as DHT11 and YL69. It automates irrigation by controlling a motor based on soil moisture levels via an ESP8266 Wi-Fi module and MQTT communication. Data visualization is done using ThingsBoard for real-time monitoring and analysis.

title: IoT based Automatic Vehicle Accident Detection and Rescue
summary: The IoT-Based Automatic Accident Detection and Rescue System uses sensors to detect vehicular accidents and automatically alerts emergency services with precise location details. It integrates an Arduino board, GPS module, GSM module, and accelerometer/gyroscope for real-time monitoring. The system ensures timely rescue response by notifying predefined contacts in case of an accident.

title: IoT based Coal Mine Safety Monitoring and Alerting System
summary: The IoT-based Smart Coal Mining Safety and Alerting System uses an ESP8266 module, DHT11, MQ2, and LDR sensors to monitor environmental conditions like temperature, humidity, light, and gas levels. The system integrates with the Blynk app for real-time data visualization and response actions, such as activating LEDs or buzzers. Potential expansions, like rain sensing, are also considered for future integration.

title: IoT based Heart Monitoring System Using ECG
summary: The IoT-based low-cost ECG and heart monitoring system uses an ESP32 and AD8232 sensor to provide continuous cardiac health monitoring. It offers real-time ECG data transmission to mobile apps via ThingSpeak, enabling remote patient monitoring and early detection of heart issues. The system is affordable, user-friendly, and aimed at improving healthcare accessibility, especially in resource-constrained settings.

title: IoT based  Weather Reporting
summary: The IoT-based Weather Reporting System utilizes a Raspberry Pi 4B+ along with sensors like DHT11, BMP180, and YL-83 to monitor weather parameters such as temperature, humidity, and pressure. It integrates with ThingSpeak for data collection and uses IFTTT to send alerts when rain is detected. The system enables advanced data analysis using MATLAB for improved weather forecasting and notifications.

title: IoT based  Weather Reporting
summary: The IoT-based Weather Reporting System uses a Raspberry Pi 4B+ with sensors like DHT11, BMP180, and YL-83 to monitor weather parameters such as temperature, humidity, and pressure. Data is collected via ThingSpeak Cloud, and alerts are triggered for rain detection using IFTTT. MATLAB is used for advanced data analysis to enhance forecasting and notifications.

title: IoT Early Flood Detection & Avoidance
summary: The IoT-based flood detection system uses an ESP8266 microcontroller and an ultrasonic sensor to monitor water levels in real-time. The system displays distance measurements on the Blynk app and triggers visual and audible alerts via LEDs and a buzzer based on predefined distance thresholds. This open-source project is designed for flood monitoring and early warning systems.

title: IoT Garbage Monitoring Using Raspberry Pi
summary: The IoT-based garbage collection system uses a Raspberry Pi 3 model B and ultrasonic sensors to monitor garbage levels in bins. The system leverages Python, Node.js, and Socket.io for data processing and communication. It enables smart garbage collection management, providing real-time updates to optimize waste collection routes.

title: IoT Circuit Breaker Project Women Safety Night Patrolling
summary: "Samraksh" is an IoT-based women safety device designed to provide real-time location tracking and alerts in distress situations. The system uses a GPS module, ESP8266, and a buzzer to notify trusted individuals when a woman is in danger. The device sends location data to the cloud, enabling quick response through Google Maps for emergency assistance.

title: IoT Robot
summary: The IoT-based robot can be controlled remotely via a website or mobile device using a Raspberry Pi, integrating sensors, camera streaming, and motor control. It functions as a personal assistant, offering real-time monitoring and data feedback through live streaming and sensor alerts. The project aims to enhance automation and security, with potential applications in home monitoring and robotics.

title: IoT Energy Meter with Current, Voltage and Cost Monitoring System
summary: The IoT-based Smart Energy Meter tracks live electricity usage via an Arduino Uno connected to a current sensor and ESP8266 Wi-Fi module. The data is sent to a Django web application, where users can view and download usage statistics in charts and Excel format. The system allows users to monitor daily and monthly power consumption along with bill calculations.

title: IoT Industry Protection System Arduino
summary: The IoT Industry Protection system uses Arduino to monitor industrial equipment for potential hazards. It integrates various sensors to detect issues such as gas leaks, temperature anomalies, and equipment malfunctions. Alerts are sent to the user via a connected network, ensuring timely responses to prevent accidents.

title: IoT Paralysis Patient Health Care Project
summary: The IoT-based automated healthcare monitoring system for paralysis patients uses sensors and actuators to track vital signs like heart rate and body temperature. It sends real-time data to a web interface, ensuring timely alerts for caregivers. The system aims to improve patient care by continuously monitoring and responding to health changes.

title: IoT Smart Mirror With News & Temperature
summary: The IoT-based smart mirror project displays useful information like news, weather, calendar, and time while also allowing voice control for appliances like lights and fans. It uses a Raspberry Pi 3, voice recognition, and a web portal for global appliance control. The mirror provides an interactive and modern way to manage daily tasks and home automation.

title: IoT Garbage Monitoring With Weight Sensing
summary: The Smart Garbage Monitoring System helps automate the process of monitoring garbage bins in urban areas. Using IoT and various sensors, this system will inform waste collection teams when bins are full. This reduces human effort, improves waste management efficiency, and contributes to a cleaner environment.

title: IoT Asset tracking System
summary: This project demonstrates an IoT solution for fleet telematics and asset tracking, using real-time data streaming from an IoT gateway device. It utilizes Eclipse Kapua for IoT cloud management, AngularJS for the frontend, and JBoss Data Grid for data handling. The solution provides a dashboard for monitoring critical package metrics like temperature, humidity, and displacement.

title: IoT Based ICU Patient Monitoring System Biometric Attendance System Over IOT
summary: The IoT-based ICU Patient Monitoring System continuously tracks critical health parameters such as blood pressure, heart rate, and body temperature using sensors connected to a Raspberry Pi. Data is transmitted in real-time to a web interface for remote monitoring by doctors, with an alert system for abnormal readings. The system is built with Python and Flask, and can be accessed globally for patient monitoring.

title: IoT Gas Pipe Leakage Detector Insect Robot
summary: The Industrial IoT-Based Gas Pipe Leakage Detector Robot is designed to detect gas leaks (Methane, Butane, LPG, Smoke) in pipes by moving horizontally and vertically. It features a robotic system with DC motors and sensors, offering real-time data transmission to the cloud via IoT for remote monitoring. The robot also includes a GPS system to pinpoint the exact location of the leakage.

title: IoT Electronic Door Opener
summary: The IoT Solutions for Smart Garage Door Opener allows users to control their garage doors using various wireless technologies such as Wi-Fi, BLE, and Zigbee. It integrates with voice assistants like Alexa and remote control via smartphone apps, leveraging cloud connectivity. The demo uses Microchip's WFI32 and WBZ451 modules for seamless wireless operation and real-time control.

title: IoT Home Automation Using Raspberry Pi
summary: This project focuses on home automation using a Raspberry Pi, where users can control various devices remotely via IoT technologies. It integrates sensors like temperature, IR, PIR, and cameras to monitor and automate tasks like lighting, temperature control, and security. The system also features real-time notifications through Twilio and Pubnub, offering remote access and control through a mobile device or cloud.

title: IoT Alcohol & Health Monitoring System
summary: This IoT-based health monitoring system tracks vital health data such as ECG, temperature, BPM, and detects smoke and alcohol levels in real-time. The data is uploaded and stored on Firebase Realtime Database for continuous monitoring. It also provides the current location of the user, ensuring timely health updates and alerts.

title: IoT Liquid Level Monitoring System
summary: Water Monitoring System is an IoT-based liquid level monitoring system designed to reduce water wastage and improve water supply. It uses ultrasonic sensors to monitor water levels and alerts the user through a buzzer and a graphical representation on a web page or LCD screen.

title: IoT Garbage Monitoring System
summary: The Smart Garbage Monitoring System helps automate the process of monitoring garbage bins in urban areas. Using IoT and various sensors, this system will inform waste collection teams when bins are full. This reduces human effort, improves waste management efficiency, and contributes to a cleaner environment.

title: IoT Based Home Automation
summary: The IoT Smart Home Automation project enables users to control home appliances through mobile, PC, voice assistants (Google Alexa, Google Assistant), and Telegram. It provides features like power consumption tracking, smart lighting with PIR motion sensors, and remote control. The project integrates multiple hardware components, including the Node-MCU ESP8266 and current sensor ACS712, for efficient home automation and energy management.

title: IoT Based Industry Automation
summary: VerneMQ is a high-performance, distributed MQTT broker designed for IoT platforms and smart products, supporting horizontal and vertical scaling. It implements MQTT 3.1, 3.1.1, and 5.0 specifications with features like QoS, TLS encryption, cluster support, and message load regulation. VerneMQ also supports multiple integrations, including databases and authentication systems, and provides real-time session tracing and multitenancy.

title: IoT Weather Reporting System
summary: The IoT-based Weather Reporting System uses a Raspberry Pi 4B+ and weather sensors to monitor and report temperature, humidity, pressure, and rain alerts. It collects data via ThingSpeak Cloud and performs advanced analysis with MATLAB. Additionally, IFTTT is used to send notifications and alerts for weather changes.

title: IoT Weather Reporting System
summary: The IoT-based Weather Reporting System uses a Raspberry Pi 4B+ and weather sensors to monitor and report temperature, humidity, pressure, and rain alerts. It collects data via ThingSpeak Cloud and performs advanced analysis with MATLAB. Additionally, IFTTT is used to send notifications and alerts for weather changes.

title: IoT Based Antenna Positioning System
summary: The Antenna Positioning System is an IoT-based automated control system that adjusts the direction of a receiving antenna using NodeMCU, Arduino UNO, and servo motors. It enables remote monitoring and control of antenna positioning through a web interface, using secure communication channels. The system allows antenna movement across long distances, ensuring accurate alignment with satellites or transmitting stations.

title: IoT Based Fire Department Alerting System
summary: The Arduino IoT-based Fire Alert System detects fires using smoke and temperature sensors and sends immediate alerts to the fire department via IoT. The system activates alarms and can trigger sprinklers to prevent fire spread. Its modular design allows easy integration with other IoT devices for scalable and customizable fire safety solutions.

title: IoT Solar Power Monitoring System
summary: The IoT-based Solar Power Monitoring System uses an ESP32 board to control a street light based on light intensity and monitor solar power generation. It integrates sensors to measure voltage and AC current, with data displayed on an LCD screen and remotely monitored via Arduino Cloud. The system offers efficient energy management and control for street lighting.

title: IoT Streetlight Controller System
summary: The Smart Street Light System uses an Arduino UNO to monitor environmental conditions such as light, rain, humidity, and temperature, and controls streetlights accordingly. The system communicates wirelessly via MQTT, with the master device sending data to child devices that adjust the light based on motion detection. Solar energy is utilized during the day, reducing power consumption.

title: IoT Traffic Signal Monitoring & Controller System
summary: The IoT-based Traffic Signal Monitoring and Controller System uses sensors to detect vehicles in real-time and dynamically adjust traffic signals based on vehicle density. It prioritizes lanes with high vehicle density while ensuring equal time for all lanes in low-density situations. The system enhances urban traffic management by optimizing traffic flow and reducing congestion.

title: IoT Industry Automation Using Raspberry Pi
summary: The Raspberry Pi Industrial IoT project integrates various sensors, including RFID, temperature, humidity, pressure, and light sensors, for real-time monitoring and data acquisition. The system sends alerts via Pushbullet and plots sensor data on ThingSpeak for remote tracking and analysis. It uses a combination of hardware components like the RC522 RFID Reader and the DHT11 sensor, with the Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ as the central controller.

title: IoT Underground Cable Fault Detector Project
summary: This project develops an IoT-based underground fault detection system for power cables, allowing real-time fault location identification through voltage changes. The system uses a microcontroller to interpret sensor data and display it on an LCD while sharing the information online for remote monitoring. The solution helps power utility companies quickly identify and repair faults, enhancing system efficiency.

title: IoT Air & Sound Pollution Monitoring System Energy Meter Monitoring Over IOT
summary: This project uses IoT technology to monitor air pollution and sound levels in real-time through sensors connected to an Arduino and ESP8266 WiFi module. The data is sent to the cloud, where it is visualized in graphs and charts for easy monitoring. Authorities can receive alerts when pollution exceeds safe levels, enabling timely action to control pollution.

title: IoT Based Person/Wheelchair Fall Detection
summary: This project develops a cost-effective smart wheelchair that monitors a patient's blood pressure and detects falls using IoT technology, with data sent to a caretaker via the ThingSpeak platform. The system uses an Arduino Nano, ESP-12e module, and MPU6050 sensor for fall detection and health monitoring. It aims to provide affordable assistance to disabled individuals, especially those unable to afford expensive smart wheelchairs.

title: IoT Patient Health Monitoring Project
summary: The system uses IoT (Internet of Things) technology to monitor and transmit the health parameters of patients, especially elderly individuals. It is equipped with sensors to track heartbeat and body temperature. These values are processed by an Arduino Uno microcontroller and sent to the cloud via an ESP8266 Wi-Fi module. The data is then visualized on a platform like ThingSpeak, where doctors or family members can monitor the patients health remotely. Alerts are triggered when there are abnormalities in the patient's vital signs.

title: IoT Heart Attack Detection & Heart Rate Monitor
summary: The IoT-Based Heart Attack Detection and Heart Rate Monitoring System is designed to monitor a person's heart rate in real-time using IoT devices. It detects irregular heart rates and potential heart attacks, sending alerts to caregivers or medical professionals. The system aims to provide early detection and timely intervention for heart-related health issues.

title: IoT Based Toll Booth Manager System
summary: The IoT-Based Automated Toll Collection System uses RFID technology to automate toll collection, reducing traffic jams and waiting times. It integrates Arduino hardware with sensors, a PHP server, and an Android app for real-time data exchange and monitoring. The system also features a backend server with Node.js and a web frontend for user interaction.

title: IoT Theft Detection Using Raspberry Pi
summary: The IoT Theft Detection system uses a Raspberry Pi with a multithreaded server and two clients: one for motion detection via a camera and the other for light sensing through an ADC. When a thief is detected, the system captures an image and performs face recognition. If unrecognized, the image is stored in a database, and a tweet with the picture is sent.

title: IoT based Flood & Drought predictor
summary: The Flood Detection and Prediction system uses IoT sensors to monitor rising water levels in residential areas and provide early alerts. It aims to help communities, organizations, and individuals by sending notifications and warnings about potential floods. The system is designed to quickly detect floods, assisting motorists and road users in avoiding flood-related problems.

title: IoT Based Smart Door Locking System
summary: The Smart Door Locking System uses IoT technology to enable remote and local control of door locks via a web interface or physical buttons/keypad. It features real-time monitoring of the door status and basic security measures to prevent unauthorized access. The system utilizes a Raspberry Pi, servo motor, and a Wi-Fi module for seamless operation and control.

title: IoT based temprature controlled fan
summary: The IoT-based Temperature-Controlled Fan System automatically adjusts fan speed based on readings from a DHT11 sensor and an analog temperature sensor. It provides real-time temperature monitoring and allows users to customize temperature thresholds for optimal cooling. The system is built using Arduino Uno and a cooling fan, with temperature data displayed on a serial monitor.

title: VS Code Clone
summary: This project is a desktop application that clones the popular code editor, VSCode, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Electron. It includes key functionalities like a file explorer, terminal, code editor, and a taskbar for creating and saving files. The application replicates the core features of VSCode for a seamless coding experience.

title: Zoom Clone
summary: The "electron-quick-start" project is a minimal Electron application designed to help you get started with Electron development. It includes the essential files like package.json, main.js, and index.html to create a basic app with a browser window. This project serves as a foundation to explore more complex Electron applications and APIs.

title: Sorting Algorithm Vizualizer
summary: The Sorting Algorithm Visualizer is a web application built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to demonstrate classic sorting algorithms like Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, Selection Sort, Merge Sort, and Quick Sort. It helps beginners understand sorting techniques by visualizing the algorithms in action. The app serves as an educational tool for improving programming skills.

title: Visualization of Shortest Path Finding Algorithm
summary: The Path Finder is a web application that visualizes various graph searching algorithms such as A*, Dijkstra's, BFS, DFS, and Best-First Search. It helps users understand the working of these algorithms through interactive visualizations. Built with P5.js, HTML, and Bootstrap, the app serves as an educational tool for graph traversal techniques.

title: Maze Solver using BFS
summary: Maze Solver is a Python project that generates and solves mazes using various algorithms. It employs DFS, BFS, Dijkstra's, and A* to both create and solve the maze. The project allows users to visualize different pathfinding techniques and solve mazes efficiently.

title: Movie Recommendation Website (ML model based Full Stack Web App)
summary: KVG Movie Zone is an AI-based web application that allows users to search Hollywood movies, perform sentiment analysis on reviews, and receive personalized movie recommendations. Built with ReactJS for the frontend, Flask for the backend API, and deployed using Docker on Heroku, it uses TMDB for movie data and web scraping from IMDB. The app integrates content-based recommendation and sentiment analysis based on machine learning models.

title: Crowdfunding Online Platform
summary: The Crowdfunding Platform allows users to browse and support various campaigns through PayTM donations while ensuring anonymity and transparency. Admins can manage campaigns, including creating, editing, and deactivating them, and adding new admins. Built using the MERN stack, the platform serves as a practical solution for fundraising and charity campaigns.

title: Amazon Clone
summary: The Amazon Clone is a web application that replicates Amazon's core functionalities with an improved UI, including product browsing, wishlist, cart, and payment options. It integrates Firebase Authentication and Firestore for user management and data storage. The project is responsive, ensuring compatibility across all devices.

title: Fashion eCommerce Website
summary: The Fashion-Store is a full-stack e-commerce application built with React for the front-end and Node.js with Express for the back-end. It integrates MongoDB for data storage, Stripe for payment processing, and uses Windi CSS for styling. The app supports user authentication, product management, and a smooth shopping experience with payment integration.

title: Blog Content Management System
summary: The Blog CMS is a content management system built with PHP for the back-end and HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, and JavaScript for the front-end. It allows admins and moderators to manage users, publish and update articles, and track post counts. The system features user authentication, real-time dashboard updates, and strong security measures like hashed passwords and error page management.

title: Food Delivery App
summary: Enatega Single Vendor is a white-label food delivery solution for restaurant owners, offering order management, rider and customer apps, and customizable branding. It includes features like payment integration, GPS location, analytics dashboard, and mobile responsiveness. The frontend is open-source, but the backend and API are available through a paid license.

title: Poll App
summary: The Polling App is a project management clone built with the MERN stack, featuring user authentication, poll creation, voting, deletion, and viewing poll statistics. It uses React for the frontend, Node and Express for the backend, and MongoDB for data storage. Key packages include React-redux, Material UI, Axios, and JWT for seamless functionality.

title: GuestBook App
summary: The Simple Guestbook Application allows visitors to leave messages on a website, utilizing PHP, MySQL, and AJAX for backend functionality. The project includes a database setup, configuration, and interactive features for submitting and fetching messages. It also offers a simple and clean interface with custom CSS for styling.

title: ToDo App
summary: The TO-DO List App is a simple LAMP stack application that allows users to manage tasks with features like sign-up, log-in/log-out, and task creation/editing/deletion. Built with PHP, MySQL, and HTML/CSS, it offers a fully responsive interface. The app requires setting up a database and configuring connection details to get started.

title: Student Management System
summary: The Student Management System is a web-based open-source application designed for educational institutions, built with PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript. It features student registration, payment management, attendance tracking, exam results, and automatic SMS notifications. The system allows administrators to generate reports, issue ID cards, and customize settings, making it a comprehensive tool for managing student data.

title: Admin Dashboard
summary: The Shadcn Admin Dashboard is a responsive and accessible admin UI built with ShadcnUI, Vite, and TypeScript. It includes features like light/dark mode, a built-in sidebar, global search command, and over 10 pages with custom components. The dashboard is designed to be reusable and adaptable for future projects, focusing on modern design and efficient development tools.

title: User Management System
summary: The User Management System is a secure and efficient web application built with the MERN stack, offering features like authentication, authorization, and role-based access. It includes robust user management, task and note handling, and admin controls such as user suspension and account monitoring. With added security layers like two-factor authentication, JWT encryption, and abuse detection, the system ensures data protection and seamless user experience.

title: Virtual Queue Management System
summary: The Virtual Queue Management System (VQMS) is a mobile web app designed to streamline queue management in airports, providing a hassle-free experience for travelers. It uses Websockets for real-time updates, service workers for notifications, and integrates with technologies like Node.js, Express, and Firebase. The system helps airport authorities efficiently manage large crowds at security gates.

title: eCommerce Website
summary: The eCommerce Platform Project is a full-featured online shopping platform built with the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js). It includes functionalities like a shopping cart, product reviews, admin dashboard, and secure payments through Razorpay. The project is open-source and customizable for building robust online stores.

title: Online Distance Education System
summary: The Online Learning Platform is a comprehensive MERN stack-based platform for students, teachers, and admins, offering features like course creation, approval processes, and live video conferencing. It includes user authentication, course purchase options, and communication tools for seamless interaction. The platform integrates secure payment gateways like Stripe or Razorpay for course transactions.

title: Farming Management System
summary: The Agri-Assist Project is an innovative agricultural application built using the MERN stack and Flask API, offering two main modules: Crop-related Issues and Yield Marketing. It features plant disease prediction, crop selection, and a dynamic e-commerce platform for farmers to post and sell their crops. The project leverages modern technologies such as React, MongoDB, and Google Cloud Platform for image storage.

title: Contact Keeping
summary: The Contact Keeping App is a web application built with Node.js, MongoDB, Express.js, and React.js, allowing users to manage and store their contacts securely. It features user authentication with JWT, password encryption with bcrypt, and a responsive design using Bootswatch's united theme. The app also includes smooth transition effects for contacts using react-transition-group.

title: eLearning Portal
summary: The Online Learning Platform is a comprehensive MERN stack application designed for students, teachers, and admins, featuring user authentication, course creation, approval processes, and live video conferencing. It allows students to purchase courses, track progress, and interact with teachers, while teachers can manage courses and enrollments. The platform also includes secure payment integration and an in-app messaging system for communication.

title: NGO Connecting Website
summary: Charity Connect is a centralized platform that connects donors with NGOs to streamline the donation process. It allows donors to find NGOs based on their interests, donate securely, and track the impact of their contributions. NGOs can access more funding opportunities, showcase their work, and communicate directly with donors.

title: Notes App With Login system
summary: The React Notes App is a MERN stack web application that allows users to create, view, update, and delete notes with CRUD functionality. It features user authentication using JWT tokens and password encryption, and notes are stored in a MongoDB database. The app has a responsive frontend built with React, using Redux for state management, and deployed on Vercel and Cyclic.sh.

title: Fake Product Identification
summary: The Fake Product Identification project uses blockchain technology to verify product authenticity. It leverages Truffle, Ganache, Solidity, and Web3.js for smart contract deployment and interaction. Users can connect their Metamask wallet to a local blockchain, interact with the website, and track product authenticity through decentralized records.

title: Electronic Voting System
summary: The Decentralized Voting System uses Ethereum blockchain for secure, transparent, and tamper-proof elections. It incorporates JWT for voter authentication and an admin panel to manage candidates and voting dates. The system removes intermediaries, offering a trustless voting process accessible via a user-friendly interface.

title: Insurance Management System
summary: This project involves setting up a Hyperledger Fabric network with multiple organizations, including insurance, shop, repair shop, and police, to manage insurance-related transactions. It includes creating and enrolling identities, defining an Orderer MSP, deploying a smart contract, and connecting applications to the network. The project demonstrates how to configure and manage organizations, channels, and smart contracts for a decentralized insurance application.

title: Financial Record Management System
summary: The Blockchain Finance project uses blockchain technology to secure and authenticate banking transactions without tokens. It features a dashboard where users can add or transfer money, and it ensures transaction integrity by comparing the current and previous transaction hashes. Any tampering with the blockchain triggers a pop-up alert to notify users of potential fraud.

title: Android Document Sharing System using Blockchain
summary: The Blockchain-based File Sharing System enables decentralized file sharing using a blockchain and peer-to-peer (P2P) network. Files are encrypted using AES encryption and stored on the IPFS network, while the blockchain records the file hashes for security and integrity. The system ensures only authorized users with valid file keys can access the shared files, enhancing privacy and data protection.

title: State Government Fund Allocation & Tracking System over Blockchain
summary: The Government Fund Allocation and Tracking System utilizes blockchain technology to track and manage government funds efficiently. The project involves compiling and migrating smart contracts using Truffle and Ganache, with a Python-based backend to run the server. The system allows for transparent and secure fund allocation tracking through smart contracts.

title: Document Storage System
summary: This project implements a decentralized file storage system using blockchain technology, where users can upload and download files securely. Files are stored in blocks that are appended to the blockchain, ensuring they cannot be altered or deleted. The system uses the Proof of Work algorithm to validate new blocks, and different methods of nonce generation are compared for efficiency and security.

title: Charity Applications
summary: The Charity Blockchain Project uses Solidity, Web3, and Metamask to create a transparent and secure platform for charity organizations to manage transactions and expenditure records. It leverages Ganache for local Ethereum blockchain development and allows users to mine transactions into blocks. The project aims to enhance accessibility and transparency for charities, especially smaller organizations.

title: Simple Voting Dapp
summary: The Blockchain-Based Voting System is a decentralized application (DApp) built with React and Solidity, utilizing Ethereum blockchain for secure, transparent, and trustless voting. The system allows an admin to add voters and candidates, start and end elections, and display results in real-time. It serves as a proof of concept for blockchain-based voting, focusing on security and immutability.

title: Digital Land Registry System
summary: The Land Registration System with Blockchain is a decentralized application built using Ethereum, React, and Solidity to streamline land registration and transfer processes. It allows sellers, buyers, and land inspectors to securely register, verify, and transfer land ownership with immutable records on the blockchain. The system aims to reduce fraud, accelerate transactions, and provide transparency in land dealings.

title: Personal Identity System
summary: The Blockchain-Based Digital Identity System uses blockchain technology to securely store and manage personal identity information, including biometric data, ensuring privacy and preventing unauthorized access. Implemented with Ethereum smart contracts, the system provides a highly secure and transparent digital identity solution for individuals. This system can be beneficial for governments, offering citizens a hassle-free, paperless way to manage their identity securely.

title: Supply Chain Management System
summary: This project implements a supply chain management system using blockchain technology and smart contracts written in Solidity. The smart contract ensures transparency and secure product transfer from manufacturers to customers. The frontend communicates with the blockchain using Web3.js, and the application is deployed on the Gode Testnet using Truffle.js.

title: Medical UseCase
summary: This code pattern demonstrates how to build a blockchain-based solution for managing and securing medical data, specifically electronic medical records (EMRs), for various stakeholders, including admins, doctors, and patients. The architecture is designed to provide a secure, decentralized approach to data management using IBM Blockchain technologies, and integrates various modern tools such as VueJS, NodeJS, Redis, Docker, and Kubernetes to create a comprehensive system.

title: Todo App
summary: This is a simple Todo app built with Django, where users can manage tasks. It includes user authentication via an admin panel and allows task management through a web interface. Setup involves cloning the repo, applying migrations, creating a superuser, and running the server locally.

title: Password Generator
summary: The Django Password Generator is a web application that creates secure, random passwords based on user-selected criteria such as uppercase letters, special characters, and numbers. Users can also customize the length of the generated password. The app is built using Django and Bootstrap, providing a dynamic and user-friendly interface.

title: Personal Portfolio
summary: This project is a personal portfolio website built with Django for the backend and HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap for the frontend. It features dynamic content management through an admin interface, along with a light/dark mode toggle, live previews, and fullscreen mode. The website showcases the developer's skills and provides easy local deployment through Django's server.

title: Stone Paper Scissor
summary: This project is a Rock, Paper, Scissors game built with Python and Django. It allows users to play the game online through a web interface, providing real-time results after each round. The game is deployed live on Heroku, and the code can be run locally by installing dependencies from the requirements file.

title: Billing System
summary: The Django Billing System project is designed to help educational institutes maintain student billing records with a simple interface. It allows for easy management and tracking of various billing entries. The project uses Python and Django, with setup instructions for creating a virtual environment and running the server.

title: Movie Ticket Booking System
summary: The BookMyTicket application allows users to book movie tickets, with features for both theatre staff and end users. Theatre staff can manage movies and shows, while customers can create accounts and book tickets. The application is developed using Django and PostgreSQL, providing a dynamic system for movie ticket bookings.

title: Email Sender
summary: The Django-Email-Sender project allows you to send emails from a Gmail account using Django and HTML templates. It involves setting up a virtual environment, installing dependencies, and configuring Gmail app passwords for security. The app enables sending emails via an API endpoint by customizing the sender and recipient details in the views.py and settings.py files.

title: Web Scraper
summary: web-scraping-django is a news aggregator app built with Django and BeautifulSoup to scrape news articles from the web. It uses Celery as a task queue to save scraped articles in the database and provides an API through Django Rest Framework. The project allows users to view the scraped news articles and manage them via the admin interface.

title: Palindrome Checker
summary: palindromer-checker is a Django/Python app that validates whether a given string is a palindrome. The app is set up with Python 3, Django, and virtualenv, and can be hosted on Heroku for easy deployment. It provides functionality to check palindrome strings and includes setup instructions for macOS, along with testing and deployment details.

title: Sorting Visualizer
summary: Sorting-Visualizer is a web application built with Django and Python to visualize various sorting algorithms in action. The tool allows users to interact with and watch sorting algorithms like bubble sort, quick sort, and more.

title: Reminder System
summary: Django Task Reminder is a to-do list management application that allows users to add, modify, finish, and remove tasks, as well as assign them to others and set reminders. It integrates with a DWR-910 4G LTE USB Router to send SMS notifications for task reminders. The project also provides instructions for setting up the environment, database, and running the server, with plans to enhance features like SIM800 module integration and international phone number validation.

title: Automatic Birthdays Mailer
summary: PyWisher is a Django-based app that helps users remember birthdays by sending automatic email wishes every year. Users can upload an Excel sheet or manually add birthday data, and PyWisher will manage the reminders and email notifications.

title: Snake Water Gun Game
summary: The Snake Water Gun game is a Python implementation of the classic two-player game, where a single player competes against the computer. Players choose between snake, water, or gun, and the game follows specific rules to determine the winner. The Python project utilizes the random module to simulate the computer's choices and evaluate the game outcome.

title: Mobile Assistant
summary: Django AI Assistant combines the power of large language models (LLMs) with Django to create intelligent applications. It allows AI assistants to call Django methods, enabling advanced features like AI Tool Calling and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). The project is open-source and provides documentation and a community for collaboration.

title: Calculator
summary: Django Calculator is a simple web application built with Django that offers basic calculator functions like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. The app features a responsive design for mobile-friendly usage. It is open-source and can be installed locally by following the setup instructions provided in the repository.

title: CRUD REST API in Flask and MongoDB
summary: Django-MongoDB-CRUD-RESTAPI is a web application that allows basic CRUD operations for student marks and totals using MongoDB as the database. It provides a RESTful API to manage student details, deployed in a Docker container for easy infrastructure management. The app uses Django, Djongo, and Django Rest Framework to create and interact with the MongoDB database.

title: Calorie Counter
summary: The Django-Calorie-Tracker is a web application built with Django that helps users track their calorie intake and consumption. The project uses Python, Bootstrap, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS to create an intuitive interface for managing daily calorie data. The app allows users to log and monitor their dietary habits effectively.

title: Student Management System
summary: The Django-based Student Management System allows admins, staff, and students to manage and track various aspects of student data, including attendance, results, and feedback. Features include user authentication, role-based access, attendance management, result tracking, and feedback handling. The system also offers a clean, responsive UI and is deployed on Heroku for easy access.

title: Social Media backend
summary: The Django Social Network is a web application that offers features like user authentication, profile management, and social interactions such as posts, likes, comments, and following. It also includes chat functionality using WebSockets, video calls, and friend requests. The app supports OAuth logins, notifications, and can be deployed on Heroku.

title: Content Management system
summary: Django CMS is an open-source content management system built on the Django framework, offering features like multilingual support, hierarchical pages, version control, and frontend content editing. It supports multi-site configurations, SEO-friendly URLs, and can be integrated with other applications. The project is community-driven and backed by the non-profit Django CMS Association.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe Game
summary: This project is a Tic-Tac-Toe game developed using C++ and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts. It allows two players to take turns placing "X" or "O" on a 3x3 grid, aiming to align three marks in a row, column, or diagonal to win. The game ends either with one player winning or a draw if all positions are filled without a winner.

title: Chess Game
summary: This project is a C++ implementation of a 2-player chess game using Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles. It simulates a full chess game, allowing two players to move pieces according to standard chess rules. The program handles the game's logic, including piece movement, captures, and check/checkmate conditions.

title: Library Management System
summary: The Library Management System in C++ is a console-based application allowing both admins and students to manage library resources. Admins can add, edit, and view books, as well as manage student accounts and balances, while students can register, issue books, and track their balances. The system uses 2D arrays to store data and implements core C++ features like functions, loops, and conditional statements.

title: File Management System
summary: The CPP-File-Manager is a C++ tool that lists files, generates a tree-like directory structure, and supports ignoring specific directories and file extensions. It allows users to output the directory structure in a customizable format for integration into Markdown files. The program also provides functions for managing file paths, clearing memory, and writing the directory tree to a text file.

title: Restaurant Ordering System
summary: The Food Ordering System allows restaurant managers to manage the menu, track orders, and calculate sales, while customers can place orders and make payments online. The system provides functionalities like updating prices, calculating delivery times, and tracking popular dishes. It ensures smooth restaurant operations during challenging times like the COVID-19 pandemic by enabling efficient food delivery and order management.

title: Alumni Management System
summary: The DSA_PROJ is an alumni management system that utilizes data structures like Linked Lists and Queues to manage student records. It allows for CRUD operations, enabling the addition, updating, deletion, and editing of alumni data. The project demonstrates the application of fundamental data structures in real-world systems.

title: Gym Management System
summary: The Gym Management System is a C++ application that allows administrators to manage gym memberships, including creating, viewing, modifying, canceling, and searching for memberships. It uses input validation and dynamic storage with vectors to ensure efficient handling of membership data. The system provides a user-friendly menu interface for easy navigation and operation.

title: File Compression
summary: The File Compressor is a C++ application that uses Huffman Coding to compress and decompress text files in a lossless manner. It efficiently reduces file size by encoding the text and reconstructs the original file during decompression. The program provides simple commands for both compressing and decompressing text files, making it easy to use.

title: Implementation of Minesweeper Game
summary: This is a simple minesweeper game implemented in C++ using the raylib library for rendering and input handling. Players interact with the game using the mouse to reveal or flag tiles, aiming to avoid mines and clear all non-mined tiles. The game can be built and run via CMake, with assets and sound effects sourced from external libraries.

title: Program to remotely Power On a PC over the internet using the Wake-on-LAN protocol
summary: SimpleWoL is a cross-platform mobile application built with Flutter that allows users to send Wake On Lan (WoL) packets to remotely wake up devices over a network. The app features automatic device discovery, a user-friendly interface, and the ability to export/import device data in JSON format. Available on both Android and iOS, it simplifies the process of managing remote wake-up functionality.

title: Finding cabs nearby using Great Circle Distance formula
summary: Ride-O-Meter is a program that calculates the proximity of cabs to a user's location based on GPS coordinates, identifying cabs within a 50 km radius. It processes input data from a JSON file containing cab details and computes the distance using the Great Circle Distance formula. The program outputs the user-id and name of nearby cab drivers to a new JSON file.

title: Snake Game
summary: This Snake game, implemented in C++ using the graphics.h library, utilizes a doubly linked list to manage the snake's body and ensure smooth movement. The game also incorporates a Forest Fire algorithm for polygon filling using a queue data structure based on a linked list. The algorithm ensures efficient pixel manipulation for filling areas in the game interface.

title: Facial recognition using Python OpenCV library
summary: Tutorial to perform face recognition using OpenCV and Python. You've covered the theory behind the various face recognition algorithms, such as EigenFaces, FisherFaces, and LBPH (Local Binary Patterns Histograms). Now, you're moving into the practical part, explaining how to gather training data, train a face recognizer, and test it with new images.

title: Magic 8 Ball
summary: The Magic 8 Ball game is recreated using Python, allowing users to ask questions and receive random answers. It leverages Python's random function to simulate the classic 90's game experience. Additionally, the game records each question asked in a CSV file for later reference.

title: Sudoku Solver
summary: The Sudoku Solver is a Python-based tool that quickly solves Sudoku puzzles using a backtracking algorithm and visualizes the solution process. It features a user-friendly GUI for puzzle input, options for hints, and a solver that works in seconds. Perfect for enhancing cognitive skills, this tool offers an easy and interactive way to enjoy and solve Sudoku puzzles.

title: Ping Pong Game
summary: The Ping Pong Game is a two-player game created using Python and Tkinter, where players control paddles to hit the ball back and forth, aiming to score points. Players can move the left paddle using 'w' and 's' keys and the right paddle with the arrow keys. The game features customizable settings like ball speed and paddle size through a config file.

title: 3D AR with Python (OpenCV and NumPy)
summary: The Augmented Reality project uses OpenCV to render .obj files on Aruco markers, providing an interactive AR experience. It allows the detection and display of 3D objects on printed markers using a Python program. The project includes camera calibration and tracking features for improved marker detection and tracking performance.

title: Attend Zoom Meetings Automatically
summary: This Python script automates the process of joining Zoom meetings using image recognition. It allows the user to join meetings without audio or video, enabling them to attend without interrupting their sleep. The script requires meeting details in an Excel file and Zoom installation for functionality.

title: Message Encrypter
summary: This Python project enables encryption and decryption of secret messages to ensure privacy and security. It converts plain text into ciphertext, making it unreadable to unauthorized users. The message can only be decrypted by someone with the correct password or key, ensuring safe communication.

title: Virtual Assistant
summary: This project involves building a personal AI assistant using Python, similar to Jarvis from Iron Man. It allows functionality like weather updates, news fetching, and movie recommendations, integrating APIs such as OpenWeather, NewsAPI, and TMDB. Users can customize the assistant by filling in their details in the .env file.

title: Automatic Quote Generator (using Quotes API)
summary: This project uses Python's requests library to fetch random quotes from a public API endpoint. The generate_quote() function handles the API request and displays a random quote to the user. It also includes error handling to ensure smooth execution.

title: Guessing Game
summary: This project showcases a collection of random Python projects created by the author. It includes various small utilities and scripts demonstrating different Python functionalities. The projects range from simple tasks like generating quotes to more complex functionalities, serving as a portfolio of the author's work in Python.

title: Hangman Game
summary: This project is a Python implementation of the classic Hangman game using the tkinter library for the graphical interface. Players guess a hidden word by entering letters, with a limited number of incorrect guesses before losing the game. The game includes sound effects and allows players to retry or exit after a win or loss.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe Game
summary: This project is a Python-based interactive Tic-Tac-Toe game that allows two players to compete on a grid. Players take turns placing their symbols (X or O), and the game tracks the score while displaying the result at the end. The game can be restarted by clicking anywhere on the result screen.

title: Stock Scanner
summary: Screeni-py is an open-source project for screen recording and live streaming with support for multiple platforms (Windows, Linux, Mac OS, and Docker). It includes features like automatic video compression, seamless integration with Docker, and real-time streaming capabilities. The project is actively maintained, with resources for documentation, discussions, and issue reporting available on GitHub.

title: Random Password Generator
summary: This project includes two Python scripts for generating random passwords. The simple_password_generator.py generates a 16-digit password using the string and random libraries. The Gui_password_generator.py creates a 15-digit password with a graphical user interface built using the tkinter library.

title: Stack-Visualizer
summary: This project is a Stack Visualizer built using Python's Tkinter and Pillow libraries. It demonstrates the Push and Pop operations of a stack with visual representation, allowing users to interact with and visualize stack operations. The application is complete and provides an engaging way to understand stack data structures.

title: Track Phone Number Location
summary: This project demonstrates how to track the location of a mobile number using Python with libraries like phonenumbers, geocoder, and folium. It uses a Geocoder API to fetch the location and display it on a map. However, the method is intended for educational purposes and may not be effective for real-world use, as tracking someone's location without consent is illegal in many cases.

title: Library Management System
summary: The Library Management System is a Python-based application that integrates with a MySQL database to manage books, borrowers, and transactions. It allows functionalities such as adding/removing books, borrowing/returning books, calculating fines, and generating reports. The system also features user authentication, data validation, and a simple interface for efficient library management.

title: Binary-Search-Tree-Visualizer
summary: The Binary Search Tree Visualizer is a Python Tkinter-based tool that helps visualize various operations on a Binary Search Tree (BST). It includes functionalities for insertion, deletion, and multiple traversal methods (pre-order, post-order, in-order, level-order). Additionally, the visualizer demonstrates level-order traversal using a circular queue for enhanced understanding.

title: Ludo Game
summary: Ludo is a strategy board game where 2 to 4 players race their tokens from start to finish by rolling dice, while avoiding being captured by opponents. Players must roll a 6 to enter a token into play and advance tokens based on dice rolls. The game ends when a player successfully moves all their tokens to the finish, with obstacles and opportunities for capturing opponents' tokens along the way.

title: Searching Algo Visualizer
summary: The Searching Algorithm Visualizer is a Python Tkinter application that visually demonstrates linear and binary search algorithms. It uses the Pillow library for image handling and allows users to visualize how the algorithms search through data. The application provides an interactive and engaging way to understand searching techniques in computer science.

title: Graph Traversing Visualizer (BFS, DFS)
summary: The Graph Traversal Visualizer is a Python Tkinter application that visually demonstrates the Breadth-First Search (BFS) and Depth-First Search (DFS) algorithms. It allows users to explore how these algorithms traverse a graph step by step. The application provides an interactive way to better understand graph traversal techniques.

title: Circular Queue Visualizer
summary: The Circular Queue Visualizer is a Python Tkinter application that helps visualize the insertion and deletion operations in a circular queue. It provides an interactive representation of how elements are added and removed in the queue. This tool makes it easier to understand the circular queue concept by demonstrating its behavior in real-time.

title: Link-List Visualizer
summary: The Singly Linked List Visualizer is a Python Tkinter application that demonstrates various operations on a singly linked list, such as insertion and deletion at both ends and inserting or deleting nodes at specific positions. The visualizer helps users understand how the linked list structure changes with each operation in real-time. It provides an interactive and educational experience for learning about linked list data structures.

title: Music Player
summary: The Music Player is a Python-based GUI application built using Tkinter and Pygame, allowing users to play music directly from their computer. It features a simple interface where users can load a directory of songs, create a playlist, and play selected tracks. The app also utilizes Audio Metadata to display song information and supports essential controls like play, pause, and stop.

title: Currency Converter
summary: The Python Currency Converter is a program that fetches real-time currency conversion rates using the Frankfurter API. It allows users to convert between two specified currencies and provides both the direct and inverse conversion rates. The project consists of multiple Python scripts for handling API calls, validating currency codes, and testing functionality.

title: Cone Detection
summary: This project develops a perception pipeline for detecting the exact locations of cones for a formula racing car using camera input. It involves two stages: first, detecting bounding boxes around cones with YOLOv3, and second, precisely locating cones within those boxes using traditional computer vision techniques. Future work includes improving the model with more data and integrating 3D cone localization for SLAM.

title: Random quote generator
summary: This project is a random quote generator that fetches quotes from a public API using the requests library. The generate_quote() function makes a GET request, extracts the data in JSON format, and displays a randomly selected quote. It handles errors gracefully and can be extended to use datasets from Kaggle.

title: Snake Water Gun game
