summary: The Snake Water Gun game is a Python implementation where a single player competes against the computer. Players randomly choose between snake, water, or gun, with predefined winning conditions. The game uses the random module to simulate the computer's choices and determine the winner.

title: URL shortener
summary: Pygmy project, an open-source URL shortener built with Python. The document outlines setup instructions, features, technical information, and steps for using the API, among other details.

title: Youtube Video Downloader
summary: Pytube is a lightweight, dependency-free Python library for downloading YouTube videos. It supports both progressive and DASH streams, playlist downloads, and caption track extraction. The library also includes a command-line utility for quick video downloads.

title: Log Analyser
summary: Log-analyzer is a simple and efficient log analyzer designed for rapid troubleshooting. It reads and processes log files, displaying data by hits and supporting custom alert rules. The tool also offers flexible configuration options and supports multiple log sources and persistence drivers.

title: PDF To DOCX Converter
summary: pdf2docx is a Python tool for converting PDF files to DOCX format, preserving layout, text, images, and tables. It supports extracting data using PyMuPDF and recreating page elements like paragraphs, headers, footers, and tables. The library also offers multi-processing for efficient parsing and extraction of complex content, including nested tables.

title: AI Resume Analyzer
summary: AI Resume Analyzer. This tool uses Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze resumes, extract information like keywords, skills, and job roles, and provides recommendations and predictions to enhance the resume. It appears to be part of a project submission for a Bachelor's degree, and it utilizes technologies like Streamlit, Python, MySQL, and several NLP modules like NLTK and Pyresparser.

title: Hotel Management System
summary: The Hotel Management System is a simple website allowing users to book rooms for specific dates, while the admin can manage room details. Built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and Bootstrap, it includes a content management system. The app is supported on both Windows (using XAMPP) and Linux (via a setup script).

title: Facial Recognition Attendance System
summary: The Face Recognition Attendance System is an automated solution for marking student attendance using facial recognition technology. It captures live video streams, detects faces with OpenCV, and compares them with stored student images to mark attendance. The system eliminates proxy attendance and enhances the accuracy of attendance management in educational institutions.

title: Find Missing Person using AI
summary: The "Finding Missing Person using AI" project aims to help authorities quickly track missing individuals using facial recognition. It allows users to submit images of missing or found people via a mobile app, which are then matched with registered cases using a KNN algorithm. The system streamlines the process by leveraging AI to analyze and match faces, providing a more efficient method for solving missing person cases.

title: Recipe Generation from Food Image
summary: The "Recipe Generation from Food Image" project uses deep learning to analyze food images and generate detailed cooking recipes. It extracts key information such as the recipe title, ingredients, and step-by-step instructions from images of dishes. The system leverages computer vision and natural language generation for a seamless and user-friendly experience, allowing users to discover new recipes by simply snapping a picture of their favorite food.

title: Gesture Controlled Virtual Mouse
summary: Gesture Controlled Virtual Mouse project that allows users to control a computer using hand gestures and voice commands. The project utilizes machine learning and computer vision techniques to recognize various gestures and execute commands, making it possible to perform mouse actions, volume control, and other operations without direct contact with the computer.

title: Attendance System
summary: This Java-based attendance management system helps students track their total lectures and days missed. It calculates the attendance percentage and provides a warning if the attendance criteria are not met. Additionally, it displays the number of classes required to fulfill the attendance requirements.

title: Calculator using Swing
summary: This project is a simple calculator application built using Java Swing, supporting basic arithmetic operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It features a user-friendly interface with real-time calculations and a reset button. The calculator is implemented in Java with a graphical interface using Swing components and event handling.

title: Library Management System
summary: The Library Management System is a Java-based project designed using Object-Oriented Analysis and Design principles, with a console-based interface. It includes functionalities for Borrowers, Checkout Clerks, Librarians, and Administrators to manage library operations like book search, checkout, renewal, and user management. The system is supported by a Java DB (Derby) and comes with a class diagram, database schema, and setup instructions for easy deployment.

title: Payroll Management System
summary: The Payroll System is a desktop application built using Java, Spring, AWT, JDBC, and MySQL to manage employee data and calculate salaries. It features secure login, the ability to add/edit/delete employee details, and generates payslips automatically. The system also allows administrators to view and manage employee information and salary details efficiently.

title: Email Administration using Core Java
summary: The Email Administration Application is a Java project designed to create email accounts for new hires with a specified format. It generates an email address based on the employees name and department, creates a random password, and allows for customization of mailbox capacity and alternate email addresses. The system also includes methods to modify the password and display user information.

title: Symmetric Encryption Cyptography
summary: The Symmetric Encryption Cryptography project in Java focuses on implementing encryption algorithms for securing files or text. It uses Java's security module and cryptographic techniques to encrypt and decrypt data. The project involves understanding Java programming fundamentals, Java servlets, and the deployment of encryption systems on local servers.

title: Snake Game
summary: The Java Snake Game is a classic implementation of the popular Snake game using Java. Players control the snake to eat food while avoiding collisions with walls and the snake's own body. The game features simple graphics and real-time gameplay with increasing difficulty as the snake grows.

title: Tic-Tac-Toe Game using Swing
summary: The Tic Tac Toe game in Java is a beginner-friendly project that uses the AWT and Swing graphics libraries to create a graphical user interface (GUI). It allows two players to play the game, checking for win or tie conditions using a 2D array. Additional features like a restart button and score tracking can be added for an enhanced experience.

title: Sentiment Analysis
summary: This R project demonstrates sentiment analysis by processing text data to extract insights such as word frequency, word clouds, and sentiment scores. It utilizes various R packages for text mining, natural language processing, and emotion classification to analyze reviews and determine the overall sentiment and emotional tone. The project provides a detailed workflow for analyzing customer feedback and understanding sentiments in textual data.

title: Uber Data Analysis
summary: This project analyzes Uber data from April to September 2014, focusing on visualizing patterns and insights using R's ggplot2, dplyr, and other packages. It explores factors like ride demand, driver allocation, and dynamic pricing to understand customer behavior and optimize service. The project emphasizes data visualization techniques to communicate complex insights and guide decision-making.

title: Movie Recommendation System
summary: This project builds a movie recommendation system using Item-Based Collaborative Filtering with the MovieLens dataset in R. It preprocesses data, applies similarity measures like cosine and Pearson, and visualizes results through heatmaps and bar plots. The system recommends movies to users based on their preferences and similar ratings from others.

title: Customer Segmentation
summary: This project uses the K-means clustering algorithm to segment customers based on a dataset with 6718 rows of customer data. The analysis involves preprocessing the data, applying K-means clustering, and visualizing the clusters with clusplot. It aims to identify distinct customer segments to inform business strategies.

title: Credit Card Fraud Detection
summary: This project focuses on detecting credit card fraud using machine learning techniques to analyze transaction data. It addresses challenges like unbalanced data by applying methods such as Random Over-Sampling (ROS), Random Under-Sampling (RUS), and SMOTE. The goal is to predict fraudulent transactions using R, with the dataset containing transaction information and labels for fraud detection.

title: Book Library App
summary: This Android app is designed to manage a library system, allowing both users and admins to perform various operations such as issuing, returning, and searching books, and managing fines. It uses Firebase for backend services like Firestore, Cloud Functions, and Firebase Cloud Messaging for real-time notifications. The app provides an intuitive interface and automates tasks such as fine collection and overdue reminders.

title: Novel Library App
summary: Novel Library is an app that provides a one-stop platform for reading all types of novels. It allows users to access and read novels with an easy-to-use interface, supporting extensions for enhanced functionality. The app is integrated with Firebase and includes setup instructions for project files and extensions.

title: Women Safety App
summary: "Amaan - You Deserve to be Safe!" is a womens safety mobile app developed by Google DSC COMSATS University Islamabad. The app offers features like location tracking, SOS alerts, and emergency helplines to empower and protect women. Future plans include adding audio recording for evidence and collaborating with the government to overcome SMS charges.

title: Notes App
summary: "Yet Another Notes App" is an Android app designed for note-taking with features like MVVM setup, HILT, Coroutines, and API integration using Retrofit. It includes a complete signup/login flow and authenticated API calls with interceptors. The project is part of a tutorial series that covers both Android development and Node.js-based REST API integration.

title: Snake Game
summary: The "Android Snake Game" is a simple 2D snake game for Android, reminiscent of the classic game played in the 90s. The project requires integrating the android_simple_game_engine by copying its Java files into the game directory. It's a fun and nostalgic game designed to pass the time.

title: Shopping App
summary: This project is a shopping app developed using Flutter and Firebase, featuring both a user-friendly UI and backend functionality. It allows users to browse products, manage their cart, and make purchases. A tutorial for building the app is available on YouTube.

title: Flappy Bird
summary: This project is a Flappy Bird clone developed in C for Android, with an APK size under 100 KB. It uses OpenGL ES 2, shaders, and Android Native Activity, along with compressed MP3 sounds and PNG decoding via the upng library. The project aims to create a minimalistic and efficient game, while being inspired by various tools and libraries like Raylib and ImGui.

title: Alarm App
summary: The Simple Alarm Clock app demonstrates the use of MVVM architecture and Room persistence library. It allows users to set one-time or repeating alarms with a straightforward user interface. The app showcases essential Android development concepts like data persistence and architecture patterns.

title: Stopwatch App
summary: The Stopwatch app is built with Jetpack Compose and uses foreground and bound services to track time even when the app is closed. It features a simple UI with buttons to control the stopwatch and reset it via notifications. The project also integrates Dagger-Hilt for dependency injection and demonstrates Android service management.

title: Calendar App
summary: Simple Calendar 2023 is an offline, highly customizable Android calendar app that helps users organize their schedule with features like event syncing via Google Calendar, reminders, and a variety of widgets. It offers a clutter-free experience with no ads, supports event imports, and allows for personalized event creation. The app is ideal for managing daily, weekly, and monthly agendas, making it a perfect planner for both personal and business use.

title: WhatsApp Clone (+Backend)
summary: This project is a WhatsApp clone built using Flutter, featuring chat functionality, single/group chats, and audio/video calls. The app integrates Firebase for backend services and uses Agora for real-time audio and video calling. It also supports content sharing like images, videos, and GIFs, with additional libraries for enhanced functionality.

title: Twitter Clone (+Backend)
summary: X Clone is a social networking app inspired by Twitter, built using Kotlin and Firebase for user management, profiles, tweets, and direct messaging. The app features functionalities like creating posts with images/videos, retweeting, and sending DMs. The UI is updated to match Twitter's Android app design, offering a seamless user experience.

title: Instagram Clone (+Backend)
summary: This project is a step-by-step guide to building an Instagram clone for Android using Firebase for authentication, database, and cloud storage. The app includes features like profile management, image sharing, comments, likes, and user interactions. The course covers essential Android concepts like navigation, fragments, and Firebase integration, offering a practical way to learn app development.

title: Weather App
summary: This Weather App is built using Java and fetches weather data from the OpenWeatherMap API. It provides current weather, forecasts, and weather alerts by using a unique API key. The app is simple, user-friendly, and allows easy contribution through GitHub.

title: Quiz App
summary: The Quiz App is an Android application built with Java, offering quizzes in subjects like Maths, Geography, and Literature. It tracks quiz history using the Room Persistence Library and supports user authentication, password changes, and displaying results. The app utilizes AsyncTask for asynchronous operations and includes features like a loading indicator and SQLite database management.

title: Stock Market Analyzer
summary: The Stocks Android App is a virtual stock trading platform that allows users to search for company stocks, buy/sell stocks, and manage portfolios. It integrates with a custom Node.js backend using the Tiingo API for stock data and the News API for stock-related news. Features include SMA charts, news sharing, and saving stock data locally for persistence.

title: Document Scanner
summary: The Android Document Scanner is a library that enables users to scan documents such as notes, business cards, and receipts. It offers features like cropping, limiting the number of scans, and automatically accepting document corners without user adjustments. The library can be used with both Kotlin and Java, making it versatile for different Android projects.

title: Medication Reminder
summary: The Dose App is an Android medication reminder app built using Jetpack Compose, Material Design 3, and various Android libraries like Room, Hilt, and Firebase. It helps users stay on track with their medication schedule by sending timely reminders. The app is open for contributions and feedback, with a focus on collaboration and improvement.

title: Calculator App
summary: Calculator You is a versatile Android app offering a beautiful, customizable calculator with over 60 color themes. It features a scientific mode, unit converter, and a history tracker for efficient calculations. The app also supports translations and donations, with an active community on Telegram for updates.

title: Hangman Game
summary: Hangman is an Android app based on the classic Hangman game, featuring a user-friendly interface with placeholders for unguessed letters, a guessing limit, and a history of high scores. It allows users to customize settings like word length and max incorrect guesses. The app uses Android SDK and Canvas for graphics, providing an interactive and engaging experience.

title: Audiobook
summary: The Audiobook App is an open-source mobile application built with React Native, supporting both Android and iOS platforms. It allows users to listen to audiobooks and features a clean, modern UX/UI with full audio playback support. The app leverages libraries like React Navigation and React Native Sound for seamless navigation and audio functionality.

title: Calories Counting App
summary: OpenNutriTracker is an open-source mobile app designed for easy nutritional tracking and meal management. It allows users to log meals, track nutrition, create custom meal plans, and scan barcodes for instant food information, all while maintaining privacy. The app is free, with no ads or subscriptions, and prioritizes data security with local encryption.

title: Restaurant App (with API)
summary: This Android app allows users to register, browse restaurant menus, and place food orders online. It integrates with Google Maps for location services, Stripe for payment processing, and includes features like viewing restaurant details and managing orders. The app communicates with a REST API backend for real-time order processing and payment security.

title: Expense Tracker App
summary: The Expense Tracker Android app helps users efficiently manage their finances by tracking expenses, setting budgets, and monitoring income. It features secure authentication, receipt scanning, multi-currency support, and expense analysis through charts and reports. The app uses Firebase for data storage and provides a user-friendly interface for managing finances on the go.

title: Smart Education App
summary: E-Learn is an open-source education app built with Flutter for Android, offering features like video lessons, a calendar for planning, a leaderboard, and personalized learning paths. It supports user authentication via Google Sign-In and integrates Firebase for data storage. The app also includes an animated splash screen, interactive forums, and various educational tools for a seamless learning experience.

title: First Aid App
summary: The First Aid Android app provides step-by-step instructions, videos, and animations to guide users through emergency medical situations, helping them administer basic first aid before professional help arrives. It includes offline access, quizzes for knowledge testing, and GPS integration to locate the nearest hospital. The app aims to equip users with essential first aid skills to save lives in critical situations.

title: Fitness Tracker
summary: The Fitness Tracker app allows users to create profiles, log workouts, and track their fitness progress, including calories burned and workout duration. It features workout tutorials, social sharing, and motivational elements to engage users in healthy competition. The app uses a database to store workout data and provides insights into user activity over time.

title: Class Notes Sharing App
summary: Notefynd is a platform for students to share and view notes, articles, and videos to enhance learning. It allows users to sign up, upload PDF notes, like and comment on posts, and follow other users. Admins can manage content, verify notes, and oversee user activity through an admin panel.

title: Insta - Buy App.
summary: Instabuy is an e-commerce Android app that allows users to browse and purchase products with ease. It provides features like user authentication, product browsing, and a shopping cart for seamless transactions. The app also includes a testing APK for direct installation and use.

title: Barcode Reader App
summary: ZXing Android Embedded is a library for integrating barcode scanning into Android apps, based on the ZXing project. It supports scanning in both portrait and landscape modes, with options for customizing the UI and logic. The library also includes features like background camera management, hardware acceleration, and barcode generation.

title: Face Identification App
summary: This Real-Time Face Recognition app uses TensorFlow Lite for fast and accurate face recognition on Android. It allows users to add, import, and recognize faces offline with a simple UI. The app leverages CameraX and ML Kit for seamless performance without requiring re-training for new faces.

title: Blog App
summary: The Blog-App (VAG) connects users to a global community, allowing them to share personal moments and interact with others. Built with Android Studio, it uses Firebase for the backend and features a simple interface for easy engagement. The app is designed to help promote individuals or businesses while offering valuable content to users.

title: Chatting App (similar to WhatsApp)
summary: WhatsUp is a Flutter-based chat app that mimics the core features of WhatsApp, offering real-time messaging, voice chats, and media sharing, all backed by Firebase Firestore. It emphasizes privacy by ensuring messages are stored only on user devices, with future plans for video calls, group chats, and end-to-end encryption. The app also features offline access, push notifications, and a smooth user interface for an enhanced messaging experience.

title: Shooting Target Game
summary: Living Dead is a Unity-based first-person shooter game featuring normal and zombie modes, with AI-controlled enemies that chase and attack players. It includes various weapons, ammo, and health pickups, along with detailed enemy models and animations. The game offers a dynamic environment with custom algorithms for AI pathfinding, navigation, and raycasting for shooting, all set in a terrain-based world.

title: Endless Runner
summary: Endless Runner is a Unity-based game where the player navigates through an endless world that continuously spawns platforms ahead of them. The game uses object pooling, blended animations, and particle systems to create an immersive experience, along with collision triggers for world generation. The project explores core concepts like world generation, animation systems, and physics for an engaging endless runner gameplay.

title: Car Racing Game
summary: This project is a car racing game developed in Unity for a campus project, featuring car movements and sounds with some room for improvement. The full project, including coding scripts, is available for download via a Mediafire link, with the freedom to modify and customize the game. The project was built using Unity 2021.3.25f1, and the zip file is password-protected.

title: Warfare Game
summary: Laser Warfare is an arcade shooter game inspired by Galaxy Attack: Alien Shooter, developed using the Unity Engine. The game features intense space battles where players fight off alien forces.

title: Free Fall Game
summary: Freefall is a Unity3D game featuring skydiving gameplay, where players experience freefalling in a thrilling adventure. The game uses Zenject for dependency injection, with source code available for reference. It is available for download on both Google Play and the App Store.

title: Doodle Jump Clone
summary: This project is a Unity-based 2D clone of the popular game Doodle Jump. It features platform jumping mechanics and fun gameplay where the player controls a character to bounce on platforms while avoiding obstacles.

title: Simon Says
summary: SimonSays is a simple spin-off of the classic Simon Says game, created in Unity using C#. The game starts immediately after pressing start, challenging players to follow and repeat a series of actions. Its a fun and interactive memory game built for quick gameplay sessions.

title: Tic Tac Toe
summary: Tic Tac Toe is a classic noughts and crosses game recreated in Unity, allowing players to input their names and play against each other. The game features a simple UI and basic game controller to mark three-in-a-row for a win. It was built using Unity 2018.2 with potential optimizations for checking win conditions.

title: Pong
summary: Pong is a classic 2D table tennis-themed arcade game recreated in Unity, featuring basic physics and AI. The project was developed using Unity 2019.4 (LTS) and offers a nostalgic arcade experience.

title: Procedural Mesh Generation
summary: This project is a procedural mesh generation module for the Godot game engine, enabling dynamic 3D asset creation within the engine itself. It allows for the creation and manipulation of meshes through an array-based graph editor, offering flexibility in adjusting assets like length and width in real-time. The module is designed for use with Godot 3.1 or later and includes detailed instructions for setup and compilation.

title: Temple Run
summary: This project is a Unity-based clone of the popular Temple Run game, featuring endless running gameplay with obstacles, power-ups, and challenging mechanics. The player controls a character navigating through a 3D environment while avoiding hazards and collecting coins. The project replicates the core features of Temple Run, offering a similar running and dodging experience.

title: Snake Game
summary: This project is a 2D Snake game created using Unity, where the player controls a growing snake and must avoid collisions with its own body and walls. The game implements grid-based movement and uses data structures to manage the snake's growth. It is built in Unity 2019.4 (LTS) and provides a classic Snake experience with simple mechanics.

title: Sudoku
summary: The Sudo app is a Sudoku game built in Unity, allowing users to play with a dynamically generated board. Players can input values and the game validates their entries, providing feedback for invalid inputs. The project includes Unity assets, scripts, and a demo with visual instructions for building and playing the game.

title: Game like STACK (By KetchApp Games)
summary: The stack-game is a Unity-based demo inspired by the popular Ketchapp game, where players stack blocks to build a tower. The project includes the basic gameplay mechanics with a "Game" scene in Unity. Future improvements involve implementing object trimming by plane intersection.

title: Open World Game (Small Version)
summary: This project is an open-world 3D survival game made with Unity, featuring mechanics like inventory management, gathering resources, crafting, and building. The game allows players to explore, gather wood and stones, craft tools, and survive in a dynamic environment. It also includes underwater effects and an attacking system for a complete survival experience.

title: Car Racing Game
summary: Street Racing is a Unity-based racing game where players aim to beat their own time on various tracks. The project is a submission for the Junior Programmer course and features assets from the Unity Asset Store, including car models and road packs. The game is available to play online via WebGL, with the source code open-sourced under the MIT license.

title: Shooting Games
summary: This Unity-based First Person Shooter game features destructible objects with unique materials, accompanied by sound effects, animations, and particle effects. Players can switch between three different weapons, each with varying damage based on the material being shot. The game includes character animations for actions like running, shooting, and reloading, with detailed movement controls and comments in the scripts.

title: Zelda-like RPG Game
summary: Dungeon Fall is a top-down action-adventure game developed in Unity, inspired by classics like Zelda and Alundra, featuring exploration, combat, and puzzles within a dungeon setting. The game includes features like power-ups, cutscenes, a combat system, and support for multiple platforms (PC, WebGL, Android). The code has been refined for modularity, incorporating Clean Code and SOLID principles, with a focus on maintainability and future expansion.

title: Pokemon clone RPG Game
summary: This project is an AI-powered Pokmon battle simulator where players train a team of Pokmon and engage in battles with wild Pokmon and NPC trainers. It features advanced pathfinding algorithms, behavior trees for NPCs, and neural networks that learn from player actions to make combat decisions. The project also includes flocking behavior for flying Pokmon and customizable game parameters for enhanced gameplay.

title: Candy Crush (Match-three-like) Game
summary: This project is a Match-3 game developed in Unity, similar to Candy Crush and Bejeweled. It includes tutorial guidance and source code for building the game, available through a blog post. The game uses graphics from OpenGameArt and sound effects from Freesound.

title: Tetris clone
summary: This project is a Tetris game developed in C# and Unity, featuring both Infinity and Stage modes. It includes key features like score tracking, ghost pieces, soft/hard drops, and a preview of the next tetromino. Classic background music and sound effects from the arcade version are also implemented.

title: AR Chemistry (Markerbased)
summary: This project is an AR mobile application for learning chemistry, featuring 7 chemical elements and one reaction, built with Unity for Android and iOS. Users can interact with virtual elements using AR markers, with the option to add new atoms and reactions. The app is designed for educational purposes, allowing users to explore chemistry in an interactive way.

title: AR Book (Markerbased)
summary: This Android app uses marker-based augmented reality to enhance reading experiences, allowing users to interact with 3D models, videos, and games. It features educational activities for children, focusing on cognitive development, and smart marketing tools for real estate. The app uses real-world reading materials like magazines and children's books as markers for AR content.

title: AR Bottle Shooter (Markerless)
summary: This Unity 3D project creates a markerless augmented reality FPS game for iOS and Android, where users shoot moving spaceships in their real environment. The game uses the device's camera to track and display spaceships in the real world, allowing players to aim and shoot by tapping the screen. It provides an interactive and immersive AR gaming experience.

title: Reading Book App
summary: PIXIE is an interactive reading platform for children aged 3-10, combining e-books with augmented reality (AR) content to enhance learning and engagement. The mobile app allows users to access AR visualizations, text-to-speech, and interactive features, while the web app enables publishers to upload and sell e-books. This platform aims to revolutionize children's reading experiences with immersive technology.

title: Service App (Hospital, Business, etc.)
summary: Health Harbor is an augmented reality (AR) mobile app that visualizes the effects of alcohol on human organs using 3D models created in Blender. Users can explore how alcohol impacts different organs, with features like personalized scan mode to estimate potential damage based on personal habits. The app leverages ARCore, ARFoundation, and Unity to provide an immersive educational experience.

title: Shop App
summary: ShopOn is an Android app developed for the HackOn with Amazon 2022 challenge, aiming to enhance online shopping by using Augmented Reality (AR) to allow users to virtually try products. The app utilizes ARCore and SceneViewer to enable users to visualize product sizes, fitment, and color in their real-world environment. This solution bridges the gap between traditional and online shopping, potentially boosting customer engagement and sales.

title: AR Furniture App (Ikea Style)
summary: Couch Mirage is an augmented reality app that helps users visualize furniture in their home before purchasing. It utilizes ARCore and Sceneform to place 3D models of real furniture into users' spaces. The app is available in Israel and offers features like furniture search, measurements, and photo/video capture of AR models.

title: Hair Cutting App
summary: The AR Hair Hairstyle application in AR allows users to try different hairstyles using augmented reality technology. Built with Qt, it leverages OpenCV and Dlib for face detection and landmark identification. Users can visualize various hairstyles on their own faces in real-time through the app.

title: Handwriting Recogniser
summary: This Handwritten Text Recognition (HTR) system, implemented with TensorFlow, recognizes text from images of single words or text lines. The model is trained on the IAM off-line HTR dataset and utilizes CNN and RNN layers with CTC loss for decoding. It offers both word and text line recognition, with optional word beam search decoding for improved accuracy.

title: Chatbot for Healthcare Management
summary: This Flask-based chatbot application uses the ChatterBot library for natural language processing and is built with Python 3.6. It includes setup instructions, with dependencies listed in a requirements.txt file, and a local demo running at http://localhost:5000/. The project also includes Git commands for version control and a license that applies to the ChatterBot library.

title: Spam Email Detection System
summary: This project aims to develop an email spam detection system using machine learning techniques to classify emails as spam or ham. It involves data preprocessing, feature engineering, and the use of various models like decision trees and Naive Bayes for effective detection. The system achieved a high accuracy of 98.49%, enhancing email security and user experience.

title: Public Sentiment Analyser for Election
summary: This project performs sentiment analysis on political reviews related to Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi using Python. It involves data cleaning, text preprocessing, and sentiment analysis with TextBlob, followed by sentiment labeling and visualization. The results are presented in a bar chart showing the percentage of positive and negative reviews for each politician.

title: Parking Ticket App
summary: The Parking Ticket App allows parking enforcement officers to detect parking infractions and issue tickets. It is developed for both iOS and Android platforms using Java, Swift, and various UI components like RecyclerViews and TableViews. The app provides an efficient way for officers to manage parking violations on the go.

title: Interactive American Sign Language Translator
summary: The project of translation of American Sign Language (ASL) into English and vice versa, with an emphasis on developing a system that respects ASL as its own language rather than simply a visual form of English. The prototype uses various technologies, including MediaPipe for hand tracking, PointNet for hand gesture classification, and web animation for real-time translation.

title: Sentiment Analysis
summary: This project focuses on sentiment analysis of customer reviews using machine learning models. The work was done on Google Colaboratory, and the dataset used is provided in CSV format within the repository. Detailed references, descriptions, and information about the dataset are available in the project notebooks.

title: Predicting Student Performance
summary: The Student Performance Predictor is a machine learning tool that uses Linear Regression to predict student grades based on features like first-period grade, second-period grade, and study time. The project includes both a graphical user interface (GUI) and a command-line interface (CLI) to interact with the model. It utilizes the student-mat.csv dataset from the UCI Machine Learning Repository and offers insights into model performance and predictions.

title: Digit Recogniser
summary: The MNIST Handwritten Digit Classifier uses a multilayer neural network implemented in Keras and TensorFlow to classify handwritten digits with over 99% accuracy. The project employs the MNIST dataset, which consists of 60,000 training and 10,000 test examples of 28x28 grayscale images. Users can train the model or load a pre-trained model to make predictions on new images.

title: Predicting Music Genres
summary: The Music Genre Classification with Deep Learning project uses a CNN-RNN hybrid model to classify music genres from spectrograms, achieving 80% accuracy on the GTZAN dataset. The system was fine-tuned with a small dataset and can predict genres such as Blues, Classical, and Rock. It provides a quick music genre prediction algorithm and the code for fine-tuning the pre-trained model.

title: Music Analysis
summary: All-In-One Music Structure Analyzer, this package provides models for analyzing audio files, including predictions for tempo (BPM), beats, downbeats, functional segment boundaries (like intro, verse, chorus, etc.), and labels for these segments.

title: Generate Human Faces with DCGAN
summary: This project implements a Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Network (DCGAN) to generate synthetic human face images. It is trained on the CelebA dataset using PyTorch and Python 3.6. Key tips for improving training include adjusting learning rates and using BCEWithLogits loss.

title: Text Summariser
summary: This project provides a text summarization tool using the TF-IDF algorithm, which can summarize articles from various sources like typed text, .txt files, PDFs, or Wikipedia URLs. It leverages Spacy, NLTK, and BeautifulSoup to process and extract text, offering a quick summary of large content. The program is easy to use, with clear instructions for setup and installation.

title: Text Analyzer using NLP (Natural Language Processing text) and spaCy
summary: This workshop focuses on intermediate to advanced text analysis using Python and SpaCy, covering techniques for processing and analyzing textual data. It is based on previous versions presented at NYCDH, PyData, and Columbia University. The workshop is designed to work seamlessly in a Google Colab notebook for hands-on learning.

title: Sudoku Solver using Backtracking and OpenCV
summary: This project uses OpenCV and a camera to detect and extract a Sudoku puzzle from an image, preprocess it, and classify the digits using a Keras model. The puzzle is then solved using the Backtracking algorithm, which fills in the missing cells. The solution is overlayed on the original image for display.

title: Human Expressions Classifier
summary: This project detects and classifies facial expressions in videos using OpenCV for face detection and a CNN model for emotion classification. The dataset, sourced from Kaggle, includes 35,000 images labeled with 7 emotions. The model, using ResNet 50 architecture for transfer learning and a simple CNN, achieves around 40% accuracy in recognizing emotions like Happy, Sad, and Angry.

title: Geographical analysis of Images
summary: This project analyzes the Zomato dataset of Bengaluru restaurants, focusing on factors such as location, price, ratings, and online orders. It includes exploratory data analysis, geospatial mapping, and sentiment analysis to provide insights into restaurant types, popular cuisines, and hotspots. The findings help new restaurateurs make informed decisions on location, cuisine, and pricing strategies.

title: Cancer/Tumor detection using Image Segmentation
summary: This project involves building a brain tumor detection model using a convolutional neural network (CNN) trained on brain MRI images. The dataset was augmented to address data imbalance, resulting in a total of 2065 images. The final model achieved 88.7% accuracy and a 0.88 F1 score on the test set.

title: Plant Disease Detection
summary: This project focuses on identifying plant diseases using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN). The model is trained on the PlantVillage dataset, available on Kaggle. It aims to detect and classify diseases in plants for better agricultural management.

title: Create a Consumer Relationship Management System
summary: This CRM system, developed for a Java coding bootcamp, provides a platform for managing customer relationships. It includes user roles, client management, contract generation, event tracking, and CSV/PDF exports. Built with Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, and MySQL, it offers essential features for handling customer data efficiently.

title: bFit Cognitive and Memory Testing Game
summary: bFit is a cognitive reflex-memory testing game developed for Android using Java, where users click colored tiles as they appear on the screen. The game helps improve attention, concentration, and multitasking skills. The project involves building the UI, adding game logic, creating a guided walkthrough, and deploying the app with features like a splash screen and levels.

title: Network Packet Sniffer Analyzer Software
summary: The packet-sniffer project is a network analysis tool developed using Java and the Jpcap library, designed to capture and analyze network packets. It is built for CSE students at Ain Shams University as part of their computer networks course. The program functions similarly to Wireshark, providing insights into network traffic.

title: Create a Criminal Face Detection System
summary: The Face Recognition project is a Java-based application designed to improve face recognition accuracy under challenging conditions such as expressions, occlusions, and pose variations. It uses the Bosphorous Database for testing and integrates Java 3D API and MySQL for user management. The project involves setting up a local server, configuring dependencies, and running the application in NetBeans.

title: Wordcount Tools in Java
summary: The Java Word Count project is a Java 8 application that replicates the functionality of the Linux wc tool, providing file statistics like line count, word count, and letter frequency. It leverages Java 8 features such as Streams and Lambdas, and is built using Gradle with an automatic dependency setup. The project includes a distribution package for easy deployment and execution.

title: Exam Seating Arrangement System in Java
summary: The Exam Seating Arrangement System (ESRS) is a web application built using Java Servlets, JSP, and MySQL. It allows the management of seating arrangements for exams, with configurations handled through NetBeans IDE. The project includes installation and database setup instructions, along with login credentials for access.

title: Password Generator using Java
summary: The Password Generator is a Java console application that generates random passwords and checks their strength based on multiple criteria. It allows users to customize their password preferences and provides feedback on password strength (weak to great). The project also includes useful tips on improving password security.

title: Online Survey System
summary: SurveyBoard is an online platform that allows users to create and publish surveys quickly. It provides real-time results, displayed graphically for easy analysis. The system simplifies the survey process, making it efficient for collecting and viewing feedback.

title: Online Resume Builder
summary: CV-Resume-Builder is a Java-based application that helps users create professional and fully formatted CVs and resumes in various design formats. The tool offers easy customization and quick generation of high-quality resumes. It simplifies the resume-building process, ensuring a polished final product.

title: Snake Game using Java
summary: The Java Snake Game is a classic arcade-style game where the player controls a snake to collect food while avoiding collisions with walls and itself. The game includes simple graphics and controls, providing an engaging and interactive experience. It's implemented in Java, showcasing fundamental game development techniques.

title: Data Visualization Software
summary: Twig is a Java-based data visualization and analysis library, evolving from the original Groot project, designed for creating powerful visualizations and performing data analysis. It is actively developed and supports a wide range of graph types, including advanced charts and data fitting. Twig can be integrated into Java applications and includes tutorials for various graphing techniques and data I/O operations.

title: Electricity Billing System
summary: The Electricity Billing System is a Java-based GUI application that allows users to manage customer accounts, calculate and pay electricity bills, and generate detailed bills. It integrates with MySQL using JDBC for database communication, supporting user login, customer addition, and bill management functionalities. The system features various classes for efficient handling of operations like bill calculation, payment, and data storage.

title: Web Medical Management System
summary: The Medical Center Management System is a web-based application designed to automate patient management, medicine distribution, and record-keeping at SUST Medical Center. It allows administrative users like doctors, pharmacists, and store officers to manage patient prescriptions, medicine stock, and billing, while patients can access their prescriptions online. The system improves efficiency by replacing manual processes with a computerized solution accessible both within the medical center and remotely via the internet.

title: Supply Chain Management System
summary: This project implements a backend system for supply chain management using the Activiti engine, featuring global cache and message queue handling, process coordination, and REST APIs for frontend interaction. It includes components for managing business processes, custom listeners, and integration with MySQL and Tomcat. The system can be run in both IntelliJ IDEA and Spring Tool Suite with dependencies on the Vessel Frontend project.

title: Bookshop Management System Using C++
summary: The BookShop Management System is a database-driven application that tracks books, suppliers, purchases, employees, members, and sales. It includes tables for managing book details, supplier information, purchase orders, employee records, and customer transactions. The system allows for efficient tracking of stock, sales, and employee details while maintaining relationships between key entities.

title: Bank Management System In C++
summary: The Bank Management System consists of three main roles: admin, staff, and customer, each with distinct permissions. Customers can perform transactions, staff can manage accounts and request account openings, while admins have full control to view, manage accounts, and grant permissions. The system ensures secure and organized banking operations with role-based access.

title: Student Record Management System
summary: The Student Record Management System is a minimalist desktop application for managing student records, with data stored directly in an Excel file to reduce data entry costs. Admin users have full access to manipulate data, while students can only view records. The system is run locally and compiled using C++ for efficient operation.

title: Contact Management System Using C++
summary: The Contact Management System is a C++ project designed to store and manage contact information such as names, phone numbers, and emails. It allows users to add, edit, delete, and view contacts efficiently. The system offers a simple, user-friendly interface for managing personal or business contacts.

title: Car Rental System In C++
summary: The Car Rental System is a Qt-based project that allows users to sign up, log in, and find available cars for rent. It is organized into 8 classes, with a focus on user authentication and database management. The system requires specifying the absolute path of the database in the connectData method for proper functionality.

title: Credit Card Validator
summary: The Credit Card Validator is a C++ program that checks the validity of credit card numbers using Luhn's Algorithm. It was created as part of the user's first computing course at SFU. The program verifies card numbers by performing a checksum calculation to ensure they are correctly formatted.

title: Sudoku Game
summary: The Sudoku C++ game allows users to play a 9x9 Sudoku puzzle interactively or solve it using two different algorithms: backtracking and alternating projections. The game supports command-line configuration, including options for game size, random seed, and pre-filled cells. It also includes a speed test feature to compare the performance of the two solvers.

title: Trading Application Project In C++
summary: Qt Bitcoin Trader is a software for fast order management, real-time data monitoring, and automated trading using JavaScript scripts. It is built with Qt, OpenSSL, and AES 256 encryption for secure key and secret protection. The software supports multiple exchanges, offers customizable rules, and provides advanced features like trade history and fee calculations.

title: Casino Number Guessing Game
summary: The Casino Number Game, Baccarat, allows players to choose between 'banker' or 'player' and aims to have a hand closest to 9 after two cards are drawn. If the sum exceeds 9, a third card is drawn to adjust the total. The game stops drawing additional cards if the initial two cards total 8 or 9.

title: Sales Management System
summary: The Real Estate Sales Management (RESMS) System is designed to streamline the management of real estate sales processes. It helps track properties, sales, and customer interactions efficiently. The system also provides reporting tools for sales performance and inventory management.

title: Face Detection App with C++
summary: FeatureDetection is a library designed for face and facial feature detection in 2D images. It offers real-time tracking capabilities to identify and monitor facial features. The library also includes demo applications for practical use and testing.

title: Digital Calculator
summary: The C++ Command Line Calculator is a simple program that offers both regular and scientific calculation modes. It features two classes: Calculator for basic operations and Scientific for advanced functions like sin, cos, and logarithms. The program supports memory functions, allowing users to store and reuse results during calculations.
